title: Zwilling's Presidents' Day Sale Includes Its Iconic Dutch Oven
description: Shop it before it sells out! READ MORE...
author: Morgan Pryor
excerpt: Shop it before it sells out!
text: Tools & EquipmentSales & DealsMorgan PryorCommerce Assistant EditorI cover must-have home products, sales, and brand launches. Prior to working at ATM, I earned my degree in Culture Writing and Criticism from NYU, and I interned at publications like CNN Underscored, TV Insider, Texas Monthly (I'm a Dallas native), and more. When I'm not writing, I'm usually at the movies or browsing in a thrift store.Micki WagnerMicki WagnerCommerce WriterI cover everything kitchen-related, from cookware and countertop appliances to pantry staples and cleaning and organizing must-haves. I’m based in New York, NY.published nowWe independently select these products—if you buy from one of our links, we may earn a commission. All prices were accurate at the time of publishing.Credit: siamionau pavel/ ShutterstockI tend to make easy dinners throughout the week, and I think that I’ve gotten my go-to dishes to a place where they’re as delicious as they are time efficient. It took a bit of trial and error to get to that point, figuring out over time what tools make the process totally seamless. I’ve come to realize that even if a recipe is low-lift, if my tools aren’t up to par, then it can make the whole process way more difficult. These days, I have a reliable Dutch oven that I know will heat up quickly and evenly every single time; I have a trusty chef’s knife that’ll make meal prepping feel effortless; and I use a nonstick pan that always cleans up painlessly. If you’re still on the hunt for kitchen gear that’ll make your life easier, then I have to get Zwilling’s Presidents’ Day sale on your radar ASAP. The retailer has priced restaurant-quality knives, Staub cookware, and more for way less, and items are already going fast. I’ve singled out some of the best deals to snag below before they’re gone!1 / 10Zwilling$199.99was $399.99Dull, hard-to-handle knives will make meal prepping a huge hassle, so if yours is in need of an upgrade, this 50%-off set will do the trick. It’s German-made using a special formula, high-carbon stainless steel. Paired with Zwilling’s signature ice-hardening technique that keeps the blades sharp longer, I’m willing to bet you’ll reach for this set every day for years.2 / 10Zwilling$279.99was $439.99Staub is known for its high-quality cocottes, which have taller sides and a slimmer design compared with Dutch ovens. “Because I like to use my cocotte for dishes that involve lots of liquid, like chicken adobo, the taller sides reduce the chance of boilovers and minimize mess,” says our review of the 5-quart version. “This is great for frying, too.”3 / 10Zwilling$99.99was $169.99If your kitchen needs some new blades but you don’t want to commit to a full set, then the brand has a three-piece one that’ll get the job done. Also offering all of the aforementioned construction benefits, this set includes a chef’s knife for tasks like slicing poultry and fish and chopping herbs, a serrated utility knife for cutting bread, and a paring knife for peeling fruit.4 / 10Zwilling$99.99was $149.99The most versatile and important blade you can have in your collection, this chef’s knife will chop up onions and mince garlic with ease. This one is especially suited for those with smaller hands, thanks to its 9% smaller blade profile and 24% lighter weight compared with Zwilling’s original Pro knives.5 / 10Zwilling$49.99was $119.99Another knife that’ll save you so much meal prep time is the Rocking Santoku Knife. It’s built for smaller kitchen tasks like dicing veggies and chopping herbs and slicing meat into thin cuts. The design will be comfortable in your hand, preventing fatigue even if you have a larger amount of food to cut.6 / 10Zwilling$79.99was $139.99Considering how rare it is to come across a do-it-all pan that’s well under $100, you’re not going to want to pass up Zwilling’s Perfect Pan. It has a superstrong nonstick coating that you can even use metal utensils on (and if you’re a nonstick pan user, you know that’s serious!). Plus, you can pop it right into your dishwasher, so cleanup could not be easier.7 / 10Zwilling$179.99was $309.99Staub truly makes some of the most beautiful cookware — and this braiser is no exception. It has an enameled cast-iron interior, so you can get some good color on chicken thighs, pork, and beef. Plus, since it can go in the oven, it’s great for making pot roast, one-pot baked pastas, and more.8 / 10Zwilling$229.99was $419.99This oval Dutch oven is stunning! Any of the available colors would look beautiful in any kitchen — and even better that you can save hundreds of dollars on it right now! It has a roomy 6.25-quart capacity, can be used in the oven or on any type of stovetop, and has an enameled cast-iron interior, so you get the benefits of cast-iron cookware without the hassle.9 / 10Zwilling$99.99was $169.99Having a good set of baking dishes is a necessity — especially if you’re someone who loves the ease of an oven-made dinner. In this set from Staub, you’ll get three different sizes of dishes, so you can make a hearty casserole for a big family dinner or a roasted side of broccoli just for you.10 / 10Zwilling$39.99was $64.99Everyone needs a nonstick fry pan for those nights when you don’t want to spend hours scrubbing at the sink. Even though this one’s interior is coated in easy-release ceramic nonstick, the exterior is fully clad stainless steel that heats up evenly, so you’ll get the best of both worlds.My Kitchn HelperGet our favorite editor-tested and -approved finds sent twice a week to your inbox.
html:
• Tools & Equipment
  • Sales & Deals

Morgan PryorCommerce Assistant Editor

I cover must-have home products, sales, and brand launches. Prior to working at ATM, I earned my degree in Culture Writing and Criticism from NYU, and I interned at publications like CNN Underscored, TV Insider, Texas Monthly (I'm a Dallas native), and more. When I'm not writing, I'm usually at the movies or browsing in a thrift store.

Micki Wagner

Micki WagnerCommerce Writer

I cover everything kitchen-related, from cookware and countertop appliances to pantry staples and cleaning and organizing must-haves. I’m based in New York, NY.

published now

We independently select these products—if you buy from one of our links, we may earn a commission. All prices were accurate at the time of publishing.

I tend to make easy dinners throughout the week, and I think that I’ve gotten my go-to dishes to a place where they’re as delicious as they are time efficient. It took a bit of trial and error to get to that point, figuring out over time what tools make the process totally seamless. I’ve come to realize that even if a recipe is low-lift, if my tools aren’t up to par, then it can make the whole process way more difficult. 

These days, I have a reliable Dutch oven that I know will heat up quickly and evenly every single time; I have a trusty chef’s knife that’ll make meal prepping feel effortless; and I use a nonstick pan that always cleans up painlessly. If you’re still on the hunt for kitchen gear that’ll make your life easier, then I have to get Zwilling’s Presidents’ Day sale on your radar ASAP. The retailer has priced restaurant-quality knives, Staub cookware, and more for way less, and items are already going fast. I’ve singled out some of the best deals to snag below before they’re gone!

1 / 10

Zwilling

$199.99

was $399.99

Dull, hard-to-handle knives will make meal prepping a huge hassle, so if yours is in need of an upgrade, this 50%-off set will do the trick. It’s German-made using a special formula, high-carbon stainless steel. Paired with Zwilling’s signature ice-hardening technique that keeps the blades sharp longer, I’m willing to bet you’ll reach for this set every day for years.

2 / 10

Zwilling

$279.99

was $439.99

Staub is known for its high-quality cocottes, which have taller sides and a slimmer design compared with Dutch ovens. “Because I like to use my cocotte for dishes that involve lots of liquid, like chicken adobo, the taller sides reduce the chance of boilovers and minimize mess,” says our review of the 5-quart version. “This is great for frying, too.”

3 / 10

Zwilling

$99.99

was $169.99

If your kitchen needs some new blades but you don’t want to commit to a full set, then the brand has a three-piece one that’ll get the job done. Also offering all of the aforementioned construction benefits, this set includes a chef’s knife for tasks like slicing poultry and fish and chopping herbs, a serrated utility knife for cutting bread, and a paring knife for peeling fruit.

4 / 10

Zwilling

$99.99

was $149.99

The most versatile and important blade you can have in your collection, this chef’s knife will chop up onions and mince garlic with ease. This one is especially suited for those with smaller hands, thanks to its 9% smaller blade profile and 24% lighter weight compared with Zwilling’s original Pro knives.

5 / 10

Zwilling

$49.99

was $119.99

Another knife that’ll save you so much meal prep time is the Rocking Santoku Knife. It’s built for smaller kitchen tasks like dicing veggies and chopping herbs and slicing meat into thin cuts. The design will be comfortable in your hand, preventing fatigue even if you have a larger amount of food to cut.

6 / 10

Zwilling

$79.99

was $139.99

Considering how rare it is to come across a do-it-all pan that’s well under $100, you’re not going to want to pass up Zwilling’s Perfect Pan. It has a superstrong nonstick coating that you can even use metal utensils on (and if you’re a nonstick pan user, you know that’s serious!). Plus, you can pop it right into your dishwasher, so cleanup could not be easier.

7 / 10

Zwilling

$179.99

was $309.99

Staub truly makes some of the most beautiful cookware — and this braiser is no exception. It has an enameled cast-iron interior, so you can get some good color on chicken thighs, pork, and beef. Plus, since it can go in the oven, it’s great for making pot roast, one-pot baked pastas, and more.

8 / 10

Zwilling

$229.99

was $419.99

This oval Dutch oven is stunning! Any of the available colors would look beautiful in any kitchen — and even better that you can save hundreds of dollars on it right now! It has a roomy 6.25-quart capacity, can be used in the oven or on any type of stovetop, and has an enameled cast-iron interior, so you get the benefits of cast-iron cookware without the hassle.

9 / 10

Zwilling

$99.99

was $169.99

Having a good set of baking dishes is a necessity — especially if you’re someone who loves the ease of an oven-made dinner. In this set from Staub, you’ll get three different sizes of dishes, so you can make a hearty casserole for a big family dinner or a roasted side of broccoli just for you.

10 / 10

Zwilling

$39.99

was $64.99

Everyone needs a nonstick fry pan for those nights when you don’t want to spend hours scrubbing at the sink. Even though this one’s interior is coated in easy-release ceramic nonstick, the exterior is fully clad stainless steel that heats up evenly, so you’ll get the best of both worlds.

Get our favorite editor-tested and -approved finds sent twice a week to your inbox.
